wiki.summary: Rape Me is a song by the American grunge band Nirvana. The song was released as the second single from Nirvana's 1993 album In Utero, packaged as a double a-side along with "All Apologies."  "Rape Me" was written by Nirvana singer/guitarist Kurt Cobain in an apartment in Los Angeles, California in May 1991, around the time the band's second album, Nevermind (1991), was being mixed. It was first performed live on June 18, 1991, at the Catalyst in Santa Cruz, California, and subsequently played several times at Nirvana concerts during the next two years.

track.name: Rape Me

@Ariues, kurt said in an interview that this was his blunt statement about him hating rape, since it seemed no one else could get the message in his other songs.

around 9:55.
"writing something as blunt as 'rape me.' Having to resort to something like that is embarressing because people didn't understand like when we wrote a song like 'about a girl' and 'polly' and having to explain that and having misunderstanding about it I decided to write 'rape me' in a way that was so blunt and obvious it's like no one could deny it." -Kurt Cobain (paraphrasing from the interview)
